_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Harvest Land Cooperative

711 Front St.

Morgan, Mn. 56266



For more information contact: Aaron Guggisberg, Safety Director



Risk Management Plan-- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



1. The Harvest Land Policy



The owners, management, and employees of Harvest Land Coopertive are committed to the prevention of any 

accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work

with the local fire company, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to

the people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the storage and blending of fertilizers.



Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application to farmer's fields.



The maximum quantity stored for anhydrous ammonia is 210000 pounds.



3. Accidental Release Prevention Program



Harvest Land has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous

Ammonia, K-61.1" published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc, and the Standards of the US

Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CRF 19*10.111.  "Storage and handling of Anhydrous

Ammonia".



4. Five year accident history.



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths,

injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. Harvest Land Cooperative Emergency Response Program

A. A written Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.



B. Harvest Land has provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community Right To Know information as required under SARA title III (EPCRA).



C. Coordinated with emergency responders.



6. Harvest Land Cooperative plans to change as needed to improve safety.



Safety improvements are an ongoing process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations ar

e preformed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia or propane safety recommendations for implementation at this time.



Aaron Guggisberg

Harvest Land Cooperative

Safety Director
